unnormalised: ## Music Streaming: Gone are the Days of Tapes, Yaar!
normalised: ## Music Streaming: Gone are the Days of Tapes, Friend!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk music. Remember those days of painstakingly recording songs from the radio onto cassette tapes? Or spending Rs. 250 on a single CD at Planet M? Thankfully, those days are gone, thanks to music streaming!
normalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk music. Remember those days of painstakingly recording songs from the radio onto cassette tapes? Or spending rupee two hundred and fifty on a single C D at Planet M? Thankfully, those days are gone, thanks to music streaming!

unnormalised: It's hard to imagine life without Spotify, Apple Music, or even YouTube Music, right? I mean, seriously, think about it. Need some motivation for that morning jog around Marine Drive in Mumbai? Bam! Instant access to your Bollywood workout playlist. Feeling melancholic and missing your college days at IIT Delhi? A quick search pulls up all your favorite indie artists.
normalised: It's hard to imagine life without Spotify, Apple Music, or even YouTube Music, right? I mean, seriously, think about it. Need some motivation for that morning jog around Marine Drive in Mumbai? Bam! Instant access to your Bollywood workout playlist. Feeling melancholic and missing your college days at I I T Delhi? A quick search pulls up all your favorite indie artists.

unnormalised: Music streaming has revolutionized how we consume music, hasn't it? No more bulky CDs taking up space in your almirah. No more waiting for your favourite track to play on the radio. It’s all available, instantly, in your pocket.
normalised: Music streaming has revolutionized how we consume music, hasn't it? No more bulky C D's taking up space in your almirah. No more waiting for your favourite track to play on the radio. It's all available, instantly, in your pocket.

unnormalised: And the best part? It’s not just Bollywood anymore. You can discover artists from all over the world. I recently stumbled upon this amazing Carnatic fusion artist from Chennai just by browsing through Spotify's "Discover Weekly" playlist. Total game changer!
normalised: And the best part? It's not just Bollywood anymore. You can discover artists from all over the world. I recently stumbled upon this amazing Carnatic fusion artist from Chennai just by browsing through Spotify's "Discover Weekly" playlist. Total game changer!

unnormalised: Even Bollywood is adapting. Remember the soundtrack for *Dil Chahta Hai*? An absolute classic! Now, imagine discovering an unheard remix of "Koi Kahe Kehta Rahe" available exclusively on a streaming platform. That’s the kind of innovation we're seeing.
normalised: Even Bollywood is adapting. Remember the soundtrack for *Dil Chahta Hai*? An absolute classic! Now, imagine discovering an unheard remix of "Koi Kahe Kehta Rahe" available exclusively on a streaming platform. That's the kind of innovation we're seeing.

unnormalised: Sure, there are debates about artist compensation and the ethics of streaming (Rs. 0.004 per stream, really?), but the convenience and accessibility are undeniable. I’m listening to AR Rahman while writing this, and honestly, I can't see myself going back to the pre-streaming era. It's just too good!
normalised: Sure, there are debates about artist compensation and the ethics of streaming (rupee zero point zero zero four per stream, really?), but the convenience and accessibility are undeniable. I'm listening to A R Rahman while writing this, and honestly, I can't see myself going back to the pre-streaming era. It's just too good!

unnormalised: So, what are you listening to these days? Share your favorite streaming playlists in the comments below! Let's get this music party started! And if you are in Bangalore, you might want to check out that underground music scene. I hear it's pretty good.
normalised: So, what are you listening to these days? Share your favorite streaming playlists in the comments below! Let's get this music party started! And if you are in Bangalore, you might want to check out that underground music scene. I hear it's pretty good.
